devdoc.details: Integrates with TeleSwap's LockersManager for minting Flow: 1. User sends BTC to locker with commitment in OP_RETURN    - Commitment includes recipient address (prevents front-running) 2. User generates ZK proof of the transaction 3. User calls claimPrivate() with the proof 4. Contract verifies proof and mints TeleBTC Privacy guarantees: - Transaction details remain private (only hash is verified) - Secret is never revealed (only nullifier is public) - Hidden root selection: user proves TX is in one of N merkle roots without revealing which Security guarantees: - Front-running protection: recipient is bound in commitment at deposit time

claimPrivate(uint256[2],uint256[2][2],ui.details: The proof demonstrates knowledge of a Bitcoin transaction      without revealing transaction details

params._merkleRoots: Array of merkle roots (user proves TX is in ONE, hidden which)
params._recipient: Address to receive TeleBTC (must match commitment for front-running protection)

claimPrivateWithBitcoinRoots(uint256[2],.details: Convenience wrapper that accepts merkle roots in Bitcoin display format      (reversed byte order, as shown in block explorers) and converts them      to the circuit-compatible format. Bitcoin Display Format vs Internal Format: - Display (block explorer): 4a5e1e4baab89f3a32518a88c31bc87f618f76673e2cc77ab2127b7afdeda33b - Internal (hash output):   3ba3edfd7a7b12b27ac72c3e67768f617fc81bc3888a51323a9fb8aa4b1e5e4a

params._bitcoinMerkleRoots: Merkle roots in Bitcoin display format (reversed bytes)

convertBitcoinMerkleRoot(bytes32).details: Useful for dApps to preview the conversion before calling claim Example:   Input (Bitcoin display): 0x4a5e1e4baab89f3a32518a88c31bc87f618f76673e2cc77ab2127b7afdeda33b   Output (circuit format): truncated & reversed for ZK circuit

params._bitcoinMerkleRoot: Merkle root in Bitcoin display format

returns.circuitRoot: The converted root for circuit public input

params._lockersManager: Address of the LockersManager contract (optional until minting enabled)
params._zkVerifier: Address of the Groth16 verifier contract

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._hash: The hash of the locker script (as computed in circuit)

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: PrivateTransferClaim

NUM_MERKLE_ROOTS().notice: Number of merkle roots for hidden selection (privacy enhancement)

claimPrivate(uint256[2],uint256[2][2],ui.notice: Claim TeleBTC privately with a ZK proof

claimPrivateWithBitcoinRoots(uint256[2],.notice: Claim TeleBTC privately using Bitcoin-format merkle roots

convertBitcoinMerkleRoot(bytes32).notice: Convert Bitcoin display-format merkle root to circuit format

getLockerScript(uint256).notice: Get locker script from its hash

isNullifierUsed(uint256).notice: Check if a nullifier has been used

lockerScriptFromHash(uint256).notice: Locker script hash to actual script (for minting)

userdoc.notice: Allows users to claim TeleBTC privately using ZK proofs
